Module io.vulpine.lib.iffy
Package io.vulpine.lib.iffy

Interface Either<L,​R>

Type Parameters:
L - Type for the left value
R - Type for the right value
All Known Implementing Classes:
BasicEither
public interface Either<L,​R>
A wrapper that MUST contain either a left value of type Either or a right value of type Either.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    <X> X fold​(java.util.function.Function<L,​X> fnl, java.util.function.Function<R,​X> fnr)
    Applies fnl to the left value of this either if this is a left either and returns the result or applies fnr to the right value and returns the result.
    boolean isLeft()
    Returns whether this Either is left.
    boolean isRight()
    Returns whether this Either is right.
    java.util.Optional<L> left()
    Returns an option which will contain a value if this Either is left, else will be empty.
    L leftOr​(L other)
    Returns either the left value of this Either (if it is a left Either) or the given alternate value.
    L leftOrGet​(java.util.function.Supplier<L> fn)
    Returns either the left value of this Either (if it is a left Either) or the value returned by the given function.
    L leftOrThrow()
    Returns either the left value of this Either (if it is a left Either) or throws an EitherUnwrapException.
    <E extends java.lang.Throwable>
    L    		 leftOrThrow​(java.util.function.Supplier<E> fn)
    Returns either the left value of this Either (if it is a left Either) or throws the exception returned by calling the given Supplier.
    <N> Either<N,​R> mapLeft​(java.util.function.Function<L,​N> fn)
    Returns a new Either with the left type mapped to Either.
    <N> Either<L,​N> mapRight​(java.util.function.Function<R,​N> fn)
    Returns a new Either with the right type mapped to Either.
    static <L,​ R> Either<L,​R> ofEither​(L lVal, R rVal)
    Returns an either wrapping one of lVal or rVal.
    static <L,​ R> Either<L,​R> ofLeft​(L value)
    Returns a new left Either wrapping the given value.
    static <L,​ R> Either<L,​R> ofRight​(R value)
    Returns a new right Either wrapping the given value.
    java.util.Optional<R> right()
    Returns an option which will contain a value if this Either is right, else will be empty.
    R rightOr​(R other)
    Returns either the right value of this Either (if it is a right Either) or the given alternate value.
    R rightOrGet​(java.util.function.Supplier<R> fn)
    Returns either the right value of this Either (if it is a right Either) or the value returned by the given function.
    R rightOrThrow()
    Returns either the right value of this Either (if it is a right Either) or throws an EitherUnwrapException.
    <E extends java.lang.Throwable>
    R    		 rightOrThrow​(java.util.function.Supplier<E> fn)
    Returns either the right value of this Either (if it is a right Either) or throws the exception returned by calling the given Supplier.

  • Method Details

    • left

      java.util.Optional<L> left()
      Returns an option which will contain a value if this Either is left, else will be empty.
      Returns:
      An option of this Either's left type.

    • right

      java.util.Optional<R> right()
      Returns an option which will contain a value if this Either is right, else will be empty.
      Returns:
      An option of this Either's right type.

    • mapLeft

      <N> Either<N,​R> mapLeft​(java.util.function.Function<L,​N> fn)
      Returns a new Either with the left type mapped to Either.

      If this Either is left, the function be applied to the left value, else the passed function will be ignored.

      Type Parameters:
      N - New left type for the returned Either
      Parameters:
      fn - function to apply to the left value if this is a left Either.
      Returns:
      A new either of type <Either, Either>

    • mapRight

      <N> Either<L,​N> mapRight​(java.util.function.Function<R,​N> fn)
      Returns a new Either with the right type mapped to Either.

      If this Either is right, the function be applied to the right value, else the passed function will be ignored.

      Type Parameters:
      N - New right type for the returned Either
      Parameters:
      fn - function to apply to the right value if this is a right Either.
      Returns:
      A new either of type <Either, Either>

    • leftOr

      L leftOr​(L other)
      Returns either the left value of this Either (if it is a left Either) or the given alternate value.
      Parameters:
      other - alternate/default value to return if this is a right Either.
      Returns:
      either the left value of this either or the provided default value.

    • rightOr

      R rightOr​(R other)
      Returns either the right value of this Either (if it is a right Either) or the given alternate value.
      Parameters:
      other - alternate/default value to return if this is a left Either.
      Returns:
      either the right value of this either or the provided default value.

    • leftOrGet

      L leftOrGet​(java.util.function.Supplier<L> fn)
      Returns either the left value of this Either (if it is a left Either) or the value returned by the given function.
      Parameters:
      fn - alternate/default value provider used if this is a right Either.
      Returns:
      either the left value of this either or the returned value of the provided function.

    • rightOrGet

      R rightOrGet​(java.util.function.Supplier<R> fn)
      Returns either the right value of this Either (if it is a right Either) or the value returned by the given function.
      Parameters:
      fn - alternate/default value provider used if this is a left Either.
      Returns:
      either the right value of this either or the returned value of the provided function.

    • leftOrThrow

      L leftOrThrow()
      Returns either the left value of this Either (if it is a left Either) or throws an EitherUnwrapException.
      Returns:
      left value of this either.

    • rightOrThrow

      R rightOrThrow()
      Returns either the right value of this Either (if it is a right Either) or throws an EitherUnwrapException.
      Returns:
      right value of this either.

    • leftOrThrow

      <E extends java.lang.Throwable> L leftOrThrow​(java.util.function.Supplier<E> fn) throws E extends java.lang.Throwable
      Returns either the left value of this Either (if it is a left Either) or throws the exception returned by calling the given Supplier.
      Returns:
      left value of this either.
      Throws:
      E extends java.lang.Throwable

    • rightOrThrow

      <E extends java.lang.Throwable> R rightOrThrow​(java.util.function.Supplier<E> fn) throws E extends java.lang.Throwable
      Returns either the right value of this Either (if it is a right Either) or throws the exception returned by calling the given Supplier.
      Returns:
      right value of this either.
      Throws:
      E extends java.lang.Throwable

    • isLeft

      boolean isLeft()
      Returns whether this Either is left.

    • isRight

      boolean isRight()
      Returns whether this Either is right.

    • fold

      <X> X fold​(java.util.function.Function<L,​X> fnl, java.util.function.Function<R,​X> fnr)
      Applies fnl to the left value of this either if this is a left either and returns the result or applies fnr to the right value and returns the result.
      Type Parameters:
      X - Output type of the fold.
      Parameters:
      fnl - function that will map the value to Either if this is a left either.
      fnr - function that will map the value to Either if this is a right either.
      Returns:
      the value of either fnl or fnr depending on whether this is a left or right either.

    • ofEither

      static <L,​ R> Either<L,​R> ofEither​(L lVal, R rVal)
      Returns an either wrapping one of lVal or rVal.

      If both values are null, or both values are non-null, throws an IllegalArgumentException.

      Type Parameters:
      L - left value type
      R - right value type
      Parameters:
      lVal - left value
      rVal - right value
      Returns:
      An either wrapping the non-null argument.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if both lVal and rVal are null or both lVal and rVal are not null.

    • ofLeft

      static <L,​ R> Either<L,​R> ofLeft​(L value)
      Returns a new left Either wrapping the given value.
      Type Parameters:
      L - Type of the left value
      R - Type of the right value
      Parameters:
      value - left value for the either.
      Returns:
      a new either wrapping the given left value.
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given value is null.

    • ofRight

      static <L,​ R> Either<L,​R> ofRight​(R value)
      Returns a new right Either wrapping the given value.
      Type Parameters:
      L - Type of the left value
      R - Type of the right value
      Parameters:
      value - right value for the either.
      Returns:
      a new either wrapping the given right value.
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given value is null.
